intro: Dryandra runcinata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf dryandra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Proteaceae. It is native to Western Australia and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant is typically found in sandy soils and is adapted to the arid and semi-arid climates of its native region. It has a woody structure and produces small, rounded seed pods that release seeds when mature. Dryandra runcinata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its distinctive appearance and resilience.
